sentences: Kuradi persevest, midagi pole mulle järele jätnud!
Aga kella poole nelja ajal kobis juba minema. Monopoli [= viinapoodi], kuhu ta persevest mujale...
context: Persevest is a vulgar Estonian swear word, likely derived from 'perse' (ass/bottom) and an intensifier. It's used as an exclamation of frustration or anger, similar to English swear words like 'damn it' or 'hell'. The examples show it being used in situations of annoyance and disbelief.
